intro: Nicotiana stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited tobacco, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. Nicotiana stenocarpa is primarily cultivated for its ornamental value and has limited use in traditional medicine.
